Key Arguments: The legislation restricts access to information on topics of public or private interest.
The proposed bill is against democratic principles and likened to extreme communism.
Democracy requires the ability to engage in informed discussions on all topics.
Confidence in parliamentary decisions relies on unrestricted access to information.
The population is educated enough to make decisions if given full access to information.
Media should provide all information, not just what suits special interest groups.
Notable Quotes: The proposed misinformation bill is completely against our democracy. It is communism to the extreme under the illusion that it is about removing misinformation.
We are a well educated population, that can make decisions for ourselves if we are not restricted in having access to all the information.
